title: Predefined product categories + required vendor selection (frontend updates)

requirements.summary: Create a single canonical frontend category list matching the fixed English labels and reuse it across the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: The app has a single canonical list of allowed categories that includes: Fruits, Vegetables, Spices, Groceries, Snacks, Beverages, Household/Toiletries.
All user-facing text uses the spelling "Beverages" (not "Bevarages").

file_operations.description: Add a single canonical categories definition containing the exact English labels (Fruits, Vegetables, Spices, Groceries, Snacks, Beverages, Household/Toiletries) and a mapping to backend enum values (ProductCategory) for use in forms/UI.

Replace the inline hardcoded categories array with the canonical list from frontend/src/constants/productCategories.ts to ensure a single source of truth and consistent English labels (including "Beverages").

requirements.summary: Add a required Category dropdown to the vendor add-product form and send the selected category with the add-product call.
acceptanceCriteria: Vendor add-product form includes a Category field rendered as a dropdown/select (not free text).
Category is required; attempting to submit without selecting a category shows a clear English validation error.
Submitting a new product calls the backend with id, name, price, and category.
On successful add, the form clears the Category field along with the other fields.

file_operations.description: Add a required Category selector to the add-product form using the canonical list from frontend/src/constants/productCategories.ts; use the shadcn-ui Select component to render the dropdown (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing). Add validation for missing selection with a clear English error message, include the selected category in the submit payload, and clear the selected category on successful add.
Update the useAddProduct mutation to accept a category value (typed as ProductCategory) and pass it to the backend addProduct call alongside id, name, and price.

requirements.summary: Update the buyer-facing "Shop by Category" section to display only the new fixed category set with exact names.
acceptanceCriteria: The "Shop by Category" cards display the exact new category names: Fruits, Vegetables, Spices, Groceries, Snacks, Beverages, Household/Toiletries.
Categories that are not in the requested set are removed/merged so they do not appear separately (e.g., do not show separate "Personal Care", "Toiletries", and "Household" entries).

file_operations.description: Update the "Shop by Category" rendering to show only the canonical category set (remove Personal Care/Toiletries/Household and replace with a single "Household/Toiletries"), ensuring the cards display the exact required English names.
Ensure the canonical categories list includes the full set and supports any StoreHome display metadata (e.g., icons) while keeping the labels exactly as requested.

requirements.summary: Align frontend TypeScript bindings and usage with the updated backend Product/category types so the app builds without TS errors.
acceptanceCriteria: TypeScript build passes with Product including the category field.
Product fetching and rendering continues to work after the backend interface change.

file_operations.description: Update the generated/maintained backend type bindings so Product includes the category field, ProductCategory enum exists/aligns with the backend, and addProduct accepts (id, name, price, category) to match the backend interface, preventing TypeScript errors.
Update imports/types (e.g., ProductCategory) and mutation/query typing so product fetch/mutations compile cleanly after the interface change, without altering any non-required behaviors.
Adjust product rendering typings as needed so fetching and displaying products continues to work with Product now including category, without adding new browsing/filtering flows.
